block.p: Susannah Eastlake-Wade and Brendan Ronald Jones were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. William McD. Tully, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomew's Church.
Mrs. Jones, 30, is the manager of corporate and foundation fund-raising at the National Hemophilia Foundation in New York. She graduated from Wellesley.
The couple were married Saturday in New York. The Rev. William McD. Tully, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomewâ€™s Church.
Susannah Eastlake-Wade and Brendan Ronald Jones were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. William McD. Tully, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomew's Church.
Mrs. Jones, 30, is the manager of corporate and foundation fund-raising at the National Hemophilia Foundation in New York. She graduated from Wellesley.

She is a daughter of Nancy Eastlake of Hartford and the Rev. Stephen Wade of Leesburg, Va. Her father, an Episcopal priest, retired last year as the rector at Immanuel Church-on-the-Hill in Alexandria, Va. Her mother is the coordinator of the talented and gifted program in the West Hartford public schools. The bride is a stepdaughter of Molly Wade.
Mr. Jones, 32, is a vice president and an assistant portfolio manager at Bear, Stearns & Company in New York. He graduated from Connecticut College.

He is a son of Barbara Jones and Wendell Jones of Ridgefield, Conn. His mother is a library assistant at the Wilton Library in Connecticut. His father, who is retired, was a vice president and loan officer at the New York branch of Istituto Bancario San Paolo di Torino, an Italian bank.
